learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate a high level of understanding of the importance of occupational health and safety principles and practice in the prevention of workplace illness and disease.
Identify and apply the concepts of OHS risk management.
Demonstrate an understanding of the roles of the various OHS professionals in the prevention of workplace illness and disease.
Identify and evaluate the hazards which may be present in complex workplaces and determine appropriate control strategies.
Demonstrate empathy and sensitivity in recognising and appreciating the lived experiences of workers and understand how these stories drive the pursuit of decent work for all

assessments.task_description:
Students will accrue 1 mark for each workshop session (Weeks 2 - 12) they participate in-person in (Attendance at Week 1 for the introduction to the courses does not count). In addition students will work in their teams to complete an online Legislation Quiz in Week 8 which is weighted at 10%.

Students who cannot attend an in-person workshop session due to extenuating circumstance should contact the Course Coordinator to explore alternative assessment opportunities.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Submission must be made in person in the workshop. Students who cannot attend an in-person workshop session due to extenuating circumstance should contact the Course Coordinator to explore alternative assessment opportunities.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date: Due within 48 hours of the conclusion of the workshop by the Team Leader of that week.
assessments.task_description:
Weekly worksheets:

  • Worksheets are to be completed as a group during the workshop session time, the nominated team leader for that week will be responsible for reporting back during the workshop and for submitting the completed worksheet to Turnitin (within 48 hours of the conclusion of the workshop). The team leader only will be assigned marks for the submitted worksheet.
  • Each student will be required to submit 2 worksheets over the semester (these worksheets must align with the weeks they were the nominated team leader), they will be weighted at 15% each for a total of 30%.
  • If the nominated team leader for a week is absent that student will receive a mark of zero. If there are extenuating circumstances the student must contact the course coordinator within 24 hours and alternative arrangements may be made.


Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly note any use of AI or MT. A failure to declare generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students are to write a personal reflection based on the online content from one of Modules 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6. Topic reflections CAN NOT be written for weeks in which you were the Team Leader and submitted the worksheet.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly note any use of AI or MT. A failure to declare generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be presented with a series of short answer questions in which they will need to demonstrate their ability to understand and apply the full content of the course.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 1: Work and OHS: A history lesson

An introduction to OHSS1000. A review of the history of OHS, with reference to Ancient Egypt, the Ancient Greeks, the Romans, the Renaissance mining boom, the founding of occupational medicine, and the introduction of OHS legislation in the 18th century.
learning_activities.topic_title: Module 1: Work and OHS: A history lesson
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 1: Work and OHS: A history lesson An introduction to OHSS1000. A review of the history of OHS, with reference to Ancient Egypt, the Ancient Greeks, the Romans, the Renaissance mining boom, the founding of occupational medicine, and the introduction of OHS legislation in the 18th century.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshop Week 1: OHS a professional practice

An introduction to the course along with an exploration of occupational health and safety as a professional practice.
learning_activities.topic_description: Workshop Week 1: OHS a professional practice An introduction to the course along with an exploration of occupational health and safety as a professional practice.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 2: Decent work for all - an ILO Sustainability Goal

This topic presents the global perspective of workplace fatalities, including reference to the ILO's Decent Work program and a discussion of modern slavery.
learning_activities.topic_title: Module 2: Decent work for all - an ILO Sustainability Goal
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 2: Decent work for all - an ILO Sustainability Goal This topic presents the global perspective of workplace fatalities, including reference to the ILO's Decent Work program and a discussion of modern slavery.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshop Week 2: The impact of work globally

In this workshop students will explore work being undertaken at an international level to improve workplace health and safety
learning_activities.topic_title: Workshop Week 2: The impact of work globally
learning_activities.topic_description: Workshop Week 2: The impact of work globally In this workshop students will explore work being undertaken at an international level to improve workplace health and safety

learning_activities.topic:
Module 3: Getting sick: work-related disease

Students are introduced to the specialist field of "Occupational Health". The management of disease and illness in the workplace is discussed, including reference to International bodies such as the World Health Organisation and the International Labour Organisation.
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 3: Getting sick: work-related disease Students are introduced to the specialist field of "Occupational Health". The management of disease and illness in the workplace is discussed, including reference to International bodies such as the World Health Organisation and the International Labour Organisation.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshop Week 3: Occupational Disease

A review of the literature to identify emerging issues in occupational health.
learning_activities.topic_description: Workshop Week 3: Occupational Disease A review of the literature to identify emerging issues in occupational health.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 4: Accidents - when it all goes wrong

This topic introduces accident investigation and discusses different theoretical models for accident analysis.
learning_activities.topic_title: Module 4: Accidents - when it all goes wrong
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 4: Accidents - when it all goes wrong This topic introduces accident investigation and discusses different theoretical models for accident analysis.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshop Week 4: Accident Investigation

Students, using a case study, discuss some of the causative factors that led to the incident.
learning_activities.topic_description: Workshop Week 4: Accident Investigation Students, using a case study, discuss some of the causative factors that led to the incident.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 5: What is Risk?

An introduction to the field of Risk Management. Risk terminology is presented. The field of risk perception is also explored.
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 5: What is Risk? An introduction to the field of Risk Management. Risk terminology is presented. The field of risk perception is also explored.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshop Week 5: Risk Perception and Hazard ID

Students review the DVD "Risk + Hazard + Outrage" and discuss risk perceptions and risk communication. Students reflect on the risks they take in their lives, and what influences their risk choices.
learning_activities.topic_title: Workshop Week 5: Risk Perception and Hazard ID
learning_activities.topic_description: Workshop Week 5: Risk Perception and Hazard ID Students review the DVD "Risk + Hazard + Outrage" and discuss risk perceptions and risk communication. Students reflect on the risks they take in their lives, and what influences their risk choices.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 6: Spot the hazard and assess the risk

Students are introduced to the concepts of OHS risk management, including the hierarchy of controls. Discussion includes how to meet legal obligations for risk assessments, in particular how to take risk assessments beyond paperwork.
learning_activities.topic_title: Module 6: Spot the hazard and assess the risk
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 6: Spot the hazard and assess the risk Students are introduced to the concepts of OHS risk management, including the hierarchy of controls. Discussion includes how to meet legal obligations for risk assessments, in particular how to take risk assessments beyond paperwork.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshop Week 6: Risk Assessment in Practice

Students, using a case study, apply the Qld Code of Practice Risk Matrix and develop a range of control strategies.
learning_activities.topic_description: Workshop Week 6: Risk Assessment in Practice Students, using a case study, apply the Qld Code of Practice Risk Matrix and develop a range of control strategies.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 7: Managing OHS risk

An introduction to OHS management, in particular the role of safe places and safe people. The concepts of safety culture and safety climate are introduced, along with reference to the concept of resilience engineering.
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 7: Managing OHS risk An introduction to OHS management, in particular the role of safe places and safe people. The concepts of safety culture and safety climate are introduced, along with reference to the concept of resilience engineering.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshop Week 7: OHS Management Systems

Students using a case study will explore the role of OHSMS and OHS auditing.
learning_activities.topic_description: Workshop Week 7: OHS Management Systems Students using a case study will explore the role of OHSMS and OHS auditing.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 8: Qld OHS Legislation - WHS Act & Regulations

An introduction to the Queensland WHS Regulatory framework, including an overview of the historical development and current status.
learning_activities.topic_title: Module 8: Qld OHS Legislation - WHS Act & Regulations
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 8: Qld OHS Legislation - WHS Act & Regulations An introduction to the Queensland WHS Regulatory framework, including an overview of the historical development and current status.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshop Week 8: Legislation Look-up

Students will work in teams to find references within the QLD Work Health and Safety Act and Regulations
learning_activities.topic_description: Workshop Week 8: Legislation Look-up Students will work in teams to find references within the QLD Work Health and Safety Act and Regulations

learning_activities.topic:
Module 9: Plant and machinery safety

An introduction to hazards and controls for plant and machinery in the workplace.
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 9: Plant and machinery safety An introduction to hazards and controls for plant and machinery in the workplace.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshop Week 9: Is that safe to use?

A student led review of the hazards associated with plant, and the preventative strategies available.
learning_activities.topic_title: Workshop Week 9: Is that safe to use?
learning_activities.topic_description: Workshop Week 9: Is that safe to use? A student led review of the hazards associated with plant, and the preventative strategies available.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 10 Psychosocial hazards

An introduction to stress, violence and bullying in the workplace. Including a review of current preventative strategies.
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 10 Psychosocial hazards An introduction to stress, violence and bullying in the workplace. Including a review of current preventative strategies.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshop Week 10: Stress at Work

A student led review of the hazards associated with occupational stress, and the preventative strategies available.
learning_activities.topic_description: Workshop Week 10: Stress at Work A student led review of the hazards associated with occupational stress, and the preventative strategies available.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 11: Occupational Hygiene: Chemicals at work

An overview of the discipline of Occupational Hygiene, introduction to key concepts such as ALARA, workplace exposure standards, routes of entry. Review of legislative requirements in respect to hazardous substances and dangerous goods.
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 11: Occupational Hygiene: Chemicals at work An overview of the discipline of Occupational Hygiene, introduction to key concepts such as ALARA, workplace exposure standards, routes of entry. Review of legislative requirements in respect to hazardous substances and dangerous goods.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshop Week 11: Hazardous Chemicals

A detailed review of the the Hazardous Chemicals Regulations, including an introduction to the ChemWatch software.
learning_activities.topic_description: Workshop Week 11: Hazardous Chemicals A detailed review of the the Hazardous Chemicals Regulations, including an introduction to the ChemWatch software.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 12: Ergonomics - optimising human performance

An overview of the discipline of Occupational Ergonomics, with particular reference to the concepts of manual tasks and cognitive ergonomics.
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 12: Ergonomics - optimising human performance An overview of the discipline of Occupational Ergonomics, with particular reference to the concepts of manual tasks and cognitive ergonomics.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshop Week 12: Hazardous Manual Tasks

Discussion and application of the tools available to assess the risks associated with manual tasks in the workplace.
learning_activities.topic_description: Workshop Week 12: Hazardous Manual Tasks Discussion and application of the tools available to assess the risks associated with manual tasks in the workplace.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshop Week 13: Exam Review

Time will be provided to review a sample end of semester exam paper.
learning_activities.topic_description: Workshop Week 13: Exam Review Time will be provided to review a sample end of semester exam paper.
